Class ModelFlashCardDeck

  • java.lang.Object
    • ModelFlashCardDeck
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class ModelFlashCardDeck
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    Author:
    Trinh Nguyen
    Description: Class that stores multiple ModelFlashCard objects, the cards are managed using the Queue model. Cards are added, removed, and manipulated using queue and dequeue methods.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private int _cardCounter
      The total counts currently stored in _deck.
      private int _cardID
      The current ID that was last assigned to a newly created card.
      private ModelFlashCard[] _deck
      The array used to store all single flash cards.
      private static int DEFAULT_CAPACITY
      Initial memory size of new array deck.
      private static long serialVersionUID

    • Field Detail

      • serialVersionUID

        private static final long serialVersionUID
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • DEFAULT_CAPACITY

        private static final int DEFAULT_CAPACITY
        Initial memory size of new array deck.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • _deck

        private ModelFlashCard[] _deck
        The array used to store all single flash cards.

      • _cardCounter

        private int _cardCounter
        The total counts currently stored in _deck.

      • _cardID

        private int _cardID
        The current ID that was last assigned to a newly created card. This value will never decrement since it is required for card searching and deletion. There cannot be two cards with the same ID.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ModelFlashCardDeck

        public ModelFlashCardDeck()
        The constructor. Creates a new _deck array with default memory capacity and sets _cardCounter and _cardID to 0.
        Complexity: O(1).

    • Method Detail

      • isEmpty

        public boolean isEmpty()
        Used by other classes to check if the current deck is empty.
        Complexity: O(1).
        Returns:
        True if __cardCounter is 0, else returns false

      • enqueue

        public void enqueue(ModelFlashCard card)
        Used to add new cards to the deck or to put back in old cards, also increases memory when needed.
        Complexity: Amortized analysis of O(1). O(N) if resizing occurs.
        Parameters:
        card - The card to be enqueued,

      • peek

        public ModelFlashCard peek()
        Used by other classes to check the contents of the card first in line without dequeuing.
        Complexity: O(1).
        Returns:
        The first object in the array of _deck

      • enqueueWithID

        public void enqueueWithID(ModelFlashCard card)
        Used to create actual new cards by incrementing _cardID.
        Complexity: Amortized analysis of O(1). O(N) if resizing occurs.
        Parameters:
        card - The card to be enqueued into the model.

      • dequeue

        public ModelFlashCard dequeue()
        Used to remove the card in the front of the line.
        Complexity: O(N).
        Returns:
        The card that was removed in case it is to be used by other methods.

      • shiftDown

        private void shiftDown()
        Called to shift all the FlashCards up whenever a card is dequeue().
        Complexity: O(N).

      • increaseCapacity

        private void increaseCapacity(int size)
        Increases the memory of the deck to allow the user to store additional cards.
        Complexity: O(N).
        Parameters:
        size - The new size of the array.

      • getCardCounter

        public int getCardCounter()
        Returns the number of cards in the current deck.
        Complexity: O(1).
        Returns:
        _cardCounter

      • getCardID

        public int getCardID()
        Returns the ID of the card.
        Complexity: O(1).
        Returns:
        _cardID

      • removeAll

        public void removeAll()
        Empties the deck by running dequeue() until there is no more cards left. The deck still exist in memory in case more cards are being added.
        Complexity: O(N).

      • enqueueBacktoNext

        public void enqueueBacktoNext()
        Used by other classes to make the last card become the second card of the array. This is done by calling the enqueue(ModelFlashCard) and the dequeue() method over and over. Often used when switching between main deck and memorized deck.
        Complexity: O(N).

      • enqueueBacktoPrevious

        public void enqueueBacktoPrevious()
        Used by other classes to run make the last card the first card of the array. Used by the previous card JButton to go "back" to the previous card.
        Complexity: O(N).

      • transferCards

        public void transferCards(ModelFlashCardDeck other)
        Used to move the card from one deck to another.
        Complexity: O(N).
        Parameters:
        other - The deck the current card will be transferred to.

      • replaceCard

        public void replaceCard(ModelFlashCard card)
        When a card data is updated, this method cycles through the entire deck and update the deck on the corresponding card ID.
        Complexity: O(N).
        Parameters:
        card - The card that was updated and to be saved onto the deck.

      • deleteCard

        public void deleteCard(int ID)
        Deletes the card with the matching ID and then returns to the card the user was previously on. Used on the complete deck to delete a specific card.
        Complexity: O(N).
        Parameters:
        ID - The ID of the card to be deleted.

      • copyDeck

        public void copyDeck(ModelFlashCardDeck otherDeck)
        Used to copy the content of one ModelFlashCardDeck() to another.
        Complexity: O(N).
        Parameters:
        otherDeck - The deck that is being changed by having contents copied onto it.
